Tutorial: ^MANAGER: Great. You’re finally here. You do know what time it is, right?

c-0: ^MANAGER: Late that’s what you are. I don’t pay you to be late.
c-1: ^MANAGER: *sigh* What am I going to do with you…? You’re late, but I guess it’s okay this time.

TutorialP1: ^MANAGER: Anyways, you’re here and you need training. That’s what I’m here for. I’ll be your first customer. Let’s get right to it.
^MANAGER: Are you going to ask me for my order or are you just going to stand there?

s: ^Hi, welcome to Solstice! What can I get for you?

c-0: ^MANAGER: You’re really going to use that attitude? God, I hope this wasn’t a mistake. Get me a  Glop Chocolate.
c-1: ^MANAGER: Wow, for a late person you have a warm attitude. That’s good. I’ll have a Glop Chocolate.

TutorialP3: ^MANAGER: Congrats! You can hold a mug. Now, go ahead and put in some Glop and some Chocolate.
TutorialP4: ^MANAGER: Now put the mug at the 2nd nozzle for the machine to warm it for you.
TutorialP5: ^MANAGER: Alright. Go ahead and put it on the counter and serve it to me. Click that big serve button that only you can see. Don’t ask me how I know, just do it.
TutorialP6: ^MANAGER: ...Is what I’d say if I actually cared about what we serve here.
^MANAGER: Alright, now you’re all ready to not make a total fool outta yourself. Don’t mess up or I’m docking it from your pay 'cause I’m the manager and I can do that. Now get working.

s: ^PLAYER: Would it hurt to be less grouchy?

c-1: ^MANAGER: Umm... would it hurt you to talk less? Just do your job new-brew.

TutorialBeta: ^MANAGER:  You know you can go right. The tutorial is over. OVER. O-V-E-R. Finished. Done. Terminado. C’est fini. Go home. Get a life.
^MANAGER: What are you waiting for!? You playtested the game.
^MANAGER: The game is not done! It means come back later when the useless devs actually have more stuff for you to play.
^MANAGER: Ok I’m gonna break this game! See ya!
